sections.title: Marinate the chicken
list: Wash, dry, and zest the limes into your marinating vessel and cut them in half.
Combine the 2 TBSP oil, 1 tsp sesame oil, the zest of the whole lime and juice of half, ginger, garlic, 2 tsp brown sugar or honey, 1 tsp salt, lots of black pepper,½ tsp chili powder
Slice the chicken into bite-size pieces.  Marinate the chicken at least 15 minutes

sections.title: Prep
list: Slice onion and pepper and cut into bite-size pieces
Measure 4 TBSP or ¼ Cup peanut butter powder

sections.title: Cook
list: Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add the chicken mixture. Let it cook undisturbed for two minutes, then turn the mixture over and cook for another two minutes to let it brown. Stir, then cook for another five minutes while stirring occasionally.
Set the chicken aside and cook the onions and peppers until soft/translucent.  Up to 7 min.
If you're going to add more garlic, now's the time.  Let it cook until fragrant.
Add the broth, powdered peanut butter, chicken, and tomatoes. Bring it to a boil, reduce it to a simmer, and cook for 20-25 minutes uncovered.
Taste and adjust seasonings (salt, pepper, chili powder, brown sugar) as needed.
Stir in the spinach, and turn off the heat as soon as it wilts.
